title: NetDiffus: Network Traffic Generation by Diffusion Models through Time-Series Imaging. (arXiv:2310.04429v1 [cs.NI])
abstract: Network data analytics are now at the core of almost every networking solution. Nonetheless, limited access to networking data has been an enduring challenge due to many reasons including complexity of modern networks, commercial sensitivity, privacy and regulatory constraints. In this work, we explore how to leverage recent advancements in Diffusion Models (DM) to generate synthetic network traffic data. We develop an end-to-end framework NetDiffus that first converts one-dimensional time-series network traffic into two-dimensional images, and then synthesizes representative images for the original data. We demonstrate that NetDiffus outperforms the state-of-the-art traffic generation methods based on Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) by providing 66.4% increase in fidelity of the generated data and 18.1% increase in downstream machine learning tasks. We evaluate NetDiffus on seven diverse traffic traces and show that utilizing synthetic data significantly improves traffic fing

Title: NetDiffus: Network Traffic Generation by Diffusion Models through Time-Series Imaging. (arXiv:2310.04429v1 [cs.NI])
Abstract: Network data analytics are now at the core of almost every networking solution. Nonetheless, limited access to networking data has been an enduring challenge due to many reasons including complexity of modern networks, commercial sensitivity, privacy and regulatory constraints. In this work, we explore how to leverage recent advancements in Diffusion Models (DM) to generate synthetic network traffic data. We develop an end-to-end framework NetDiffus that first converts one-dimensional time-series network traffic into two-dimensional images, and then synthesizes representative images for the original data. We demonstrate that NetDiffus outperforms the state-of-the-art traffic generation methods based on Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) by providing 66.4% increase in fidelity of the generated data and 18.1% increase in downstream machine learning tasks. We evaluate NetDiffus on seven diverse traffic traces and show that utilizing synthetic data significantly improves traffic fing
translated_title: NetDiffus：通过时间序列成像的扩散模型生成网络流量
translated_abstract: 网络数据分析现在是几乎每个网络解决方案的核心。然而，由于现代网络的复杂性、商业敏感性、隐私和监管限制等多种原因，获得网络数据的访问受到了长期的挑战。在这项工作中，我们探讨了如何利用扩散模型（DM）的最新进展来生成合成网络流量数据。我们开发了一个端到端的框架NetDiffus，该框架首先将一维时间序列网络流量转换为二维图像，然后合成原始数据的代表性图像。我们证明，NetDiffus在生成的数据的保真度方面比基于生成对抗网络（GANs）的最先进的流量生成方法提供了66.4%的提高，并提高了18.1%的下游机器学习任务的性能。我们在七个不同的流量跟踪上评估了NetDiffus，并显示利用合成数据可以显著提高流量分析能力。
tldr: NetDiffus是一个通过扩散模型生成合成网络流量数据的端到端框架，相比于基于生成对抗网络的方法，在生成数据的保真度和下游机器学习任务性能方面有显著提高。
en_tdlr: NetDiffus is an end-to-end framework that utilizes diffusion models to generate synthetic network traffic data. It outperforms state-of-the-art methods based on generative adversarial networks in terms of data fidelity and downstream machine learning task performance.
